intro: Galium nuttallii var. tenue, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release minute seeds, aiding in its propagation. Galium nuttallii var. tenue thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
